intro: Anemia phyllitidis var. nervosa, commonly known as the veined anemia plant, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, veined leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forests or along stream banks. Its leaves are usually oval to lance-shaped with a prominent central vein. The botanical features of this plant make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
